column1: Krasnoznamensk (Russian: Краснозна́менск) is a closed town in Moscow Oblast
column4: 044 (2002 Census). It was previously known as Golitsyno-2 (until 1994).

column1: It was granted town status in 1981. It was known until 1994 as Golitsyno-2 (Голицыно-2).
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the closed administrative-territorial formation of Krasnoznamensk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the closed administrative-territorial formation of Krasnoznamensk is incorporated as Krasnoznamensk Urban Okrug.

column1: The town hosts a reserve mission control center and a primary mission control center for military satellites
column2: the Titov Main Test and Space Systems Control Center (compare the United States' Joint Functional Component Command for Space and Global Strike)
column3: which is reflected in its coat of arms.
